keyTakeAways: A former New York prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, resulting in his death.
David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter; Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges.

The body-camera footage of the beating, though silent, showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, and the lack of concern from the guards was central to the prosecution’s argument.
William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, asserted that all guards acted as a gang and showed 'depraved indifference to human life,' a key element in the murder charges.
Brooks had a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault and was transferred to Marcy Correctional Facility, where he was attacked shortly after arrival.
Six of the 10 guards indicted were charged with murder; five pleaded guilty to manslaughter, one to a misdemeanor charge of attempted tampering with evidence.
Kieffer faced a false instrument charge and was acquitted; Galliher and Kieffer were charged with second-degree gang assault and acquitted.
Fitzpatrick took over the case after state Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to representing officers in civil lawsuits.
Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards involved in the March 1, 2025, beating and death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility, indicating a broader pattern of misconduct.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the death of inmate Robert Brooks, who was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The body-camera footage, which showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, was central to the prosecution’s case and revealed a chilling lack of concern from the officers. While Kingsley was convicted, guards Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges, despite being charged with similar actions. The case underscores systemic issues in prison guard conduct, with the prosecution arguing that all guards acted as a gang and showed a depraved indifference to human life. The Onondaga County District Attorney, William Fitzpatrick, took over the case after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to representation conflicts and is now also prosecuting guards in the separate death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility. Additional guards have pleaded guilty to reduced charges or are scheduled for trial, indicating an ongoing effort to hold correctional staff accountable.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, 2 Others Acquitted
